main event: A radar object was observed in Bayonne, New Jersey on May 2, 1960, which exhibited unusual behavior such as blacking out and glowing reddish.
interesting points: The object was tracked on ground radar for 60-90 seconds, moving at speeds between 30-110 mph.
The object would black out and then a reddish glow would appear, before blacking out again.
There were two witnesses to the sighting, but only one report was received.
The description is similar to a meteor, but the duration of the sighting was considered excessive for a meteor.
Due to receiving information from only one of the witnesses, the case was categorized as having insufficient data for a full evaluation.
witnesses: two, but only one report received
